info.name: META Conversions API (Part 4 - CAPI for Offline Events)

request.description:
# CAPI [Get Started](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/get-started)

## Datasets

You can make the `GET` call to [https://graph.facebook.com/v16.0/{ads-pixel-id}/?fields=is_consolidated_container](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/reference/ads-pixel/) to detect if the advertiserâ€™s dataset is consolidated and thus eligible for passing offline events using the Conversions API.

### **Conversions API for Offline Events**:

[https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/offline-events](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/offline-events)

#### ABOUT DATASETS

> You can select the same dataset ID for website and offline event tracking. 
  

Ref.: [https://www.facebook.com/business/help/768703235046938?locale=en_US](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/768703235046938?locale=en_US)

> Instead of having separate IDs for each of your integrations, you can have a single dataset ID to represent your website, app, offline and messaging event data. 
  

Ref.: [https://www.facebook.com/business/help/750785952855662?id=490360542427371](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/750785952855662?id=490360542427371)

#### **Access Token Debugger**

[https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/accesstoken/](https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/accesstoken/)

response.name: [400] Bad Request - Missing Permission - no token provided | token without right permissions
[200] Ok - with a 'meta app user token' with 'ads_management' and 'business_management' permissions
[401] Unauthorized - expired token

header.value: OAuth "Facebook Platform" "invalid_token" "Error validating access token: Session has expired on Tuesday, 27-Feb-24 06:00:00 PST. The current time is Monday, 01-Apr-24 12:41:12 PDT."
EXCELLENT; q=0.9, rtt=11, rtx=0, c=10, mss=1392, tbw=3405, tp=-1, tpl=-1, uplat=192, ullat=0

item.name: 2) posting a Purchase event - physical store

request.description:
# Sending Offline Events Using the Conversions API

The Conversions API (**CAPI**) is Metaâ€™s recommended integration method for sending offline and physical store events to Meta for use in ad measurement, attribution, and targeting.

Ref.: [https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/offline-events](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/offline-events)

# Customer Information Parameters

Ref.: [https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/parameters/customer-information-parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/parameters/customer-information-parameters)

# Standard Parameters

This table lists all standard parameters users can send to Meta.

Ref.: [https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/parameters/custom-data](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/parameters/custom-data)

response.name: [200] Ok - event received, here is your receipt (fbtrace_id)
[400] Bad Request - no access token provided

header.value: OAuth "Facebook Platform" "invalid_request" "Unsupported post request. Object with ID '471896217364766' does not exist, cannot be loaded due to missing permissions, or does not support this operation. Please read the Graph API documentation at https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api"

request.description:
# Sending Offline Events Using the Conversions API

The Conversions API (**CAPI**) is Metaâ€™s recommended integration method for sending offline and physical store events to Meta for use in ad measurement, attribution, and targeting.

Ref.: [https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/offline-events](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/offline-events)

# Customer Information Parameters

Ref.: [https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/parameters/customer-information-parameters](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/parameters/customer-information-parameters)

# Standard Parameters

This table lists all standard parameters users can send to Meta.

Ref.: [https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/parameters/custom-data](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/conversions-api/parameters/custom-data)

# Best practices for offline events data

**Include an order ID field and enter a unique identifier for each transaction**

Ref.: [https://www.facebook.com/business/help/1798506233494677?id=565900110447546](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/1798506233494677?id=565900110447546)

response.name: [200] Ok - 4 events received, here is your receipt (fbtrace_id)

header.value: EXCELLENT; q=0.9, rtt=13, rtx=0, c=10, mss=1392, tbw=372, tp=-1, tpl=-1, uplat=1223, ullat=0
